factText: Minimal fire activity was observed today as firefighters continue monitoring for smoldering heavy fuels near containment lines and along highways.

factText: An emergency shelter is key, officials said, because many human trafficking victims are identified in the middle of the night and need immediate safety at a time when other shelters are unavailable fo. U.S. District Court Judge David O. Carter warned the County of Orange and its cities they will need to make significant progress on plans for new emergency shelter housing for the homeless, or face a . Orange County must shelter 1,550 homeless people, judge says https://t.co/czZYd7gB8a
informationNeeds: CrisisFACTS-003_general_Where can displaced people find emergency housing?

factText: A wildfire that destroyed 12 buildings and burned more than 13,000 acres near Idyllwild in the Riverside County mountains was 96-percent contained Friday and all evacuation orders have been lifted. A pair of homeless shelters inside two National Guard armories in Southern California’s Orange County shut their doors mid-July, pushing over 200 people back into the street and exacerbating the count

factText: ROAD CLOSURE Trabuco Canyon - Trabuco Creek Rd. at Trabuco Canyon Rd., is closed until further notice due to a brush fire in the Holy Jim area. #HolyFire
informationNeeds: CrisisFACTS-General-q026

factText: Trabuco Canyon ("Holy Fire") has consumed roughly 100 acres and is spreading rapidly, but is moving away of Orange County. #HolyFire Update @ 1530hrs Holy Incident: 700+ acres burning away from OC towards Santiago Peak. The blaze — dubbed the Holy Fire — erupted at 75 to 100 acres and began to spread rapidly through rugged, inaccessible terrain a short time after igniting. Firefighters are battling a 700-acre blaze near Holy Jim Canyon, which was first reported at 1:17 p.m. today.
informationNeeds: CrisisFACTS-003_Wildfire_How many acres have burned due to {event}?

factText: BREAKING NEWS: A fast-moving fire, dubbed the Holy Fire, in the Cleveland National Forest has prompted fire officials to evacuate the Holy Jim community near Trabuco Canyon. #HOLYFIRE UPDATE: A Wireless Emergency Alert was just issued: Immediate evacuation order of Holy Jim cabin residents. Visit www.OCgov.com for information. #Developing: The #HolyFire burning in Cleveland National Forest has forced the evacuation of Holy Jim community nea… https://t.co/jQ88jXwHlk
informationNeeds: CrisisFACTS-003_Wildfire_Where are the main evacuation routes for people affected by {event}?

factText: Firefighters are battling a 75-100 acre brush fire that has already destroyed one structure in the Trabuco Canyon area in Orange County. https://abc7.la/2nfWEer. FIRE IN TRABUCO CANYON HAS WIPED OUT ONE HOME SO FAR !!!
informationNeeds: CrisisFACTS-Wildfire-q004

factText: CAL FIRE is assisting the Cleveland National Forest with a fire off Holy Jim Canyon Rd, west of N. Main Divide (Orange County). #HolyFire https://twitter.com/ClevelandNF

factText: #HolyJimCanyon - Heads up everybody! Evacuation ordered.
informationNeeds: CrisisFACTS-003_general_Are evacuation orders still in place or have they been lifted?

factText: As of 3:30 pm, the fire has ballooned to 700 acres and has prompted mandatory evacuations for Trabuco and Holy Jim Canyon. A brush fire burning in the Trabuco Canyon area near Orange and Riverside counties forced the evacuation of the Holy Jim community Monday.

factText: The fire dubbed the #HolyFire was first reported at about 2:00 pm, on Monday, August 6, 2018, in the Cleveland National Forest and quickly moved ‘across the main divide’ between Orange and Riverside C

factText: BREAKING NEWS: Firefighters are battling a 35-acre wildfire in Riverside County's Temescal Valley near Terramor Road and Temescal Canyon Road. Evacuations have been ordered as firefighters battle a fast-moving brush burned more than 700 acres in the Trabuco Canyon area on Monday afternoon, according to the Orange County Fire Authority. Monday, August 6, 2018 Mutual Aid Update The City of Riverside Fire Department is actively fighting fires throughout California.
informationNeeds: CrisisFACTS-General-q004

factText: Watch live: Firefighters battle the #HolyFire, which has burned up to 100 acres in the Trabuco Canyon area and prom… https://t.co/bhgnT4ePOG.
